intro: Hieracioides umbellata, commonly known as the Umbellate Hieracioides, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
